title: The Golden Mouth
description: Your first encounter with the Archbishop of Constantinople

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: You there—I saw what you meant to do.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: A hand reaching for another man's purse. Do you think these old eyes are blind?

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: (You freeze. The Archbishop himself caught you. Your legs want to run, but something in his gaze holds you.)

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: Stay. I am not calling the guards.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: I have preached a thousand sermons against thieves—not because I hate them, but because I grieve for them.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: You wear your hunger like a cloak. I know that look. I saw it in Antioch, in the faces of those who had nothing.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: Tell me—what is your name, child?

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: [Enter your name...]

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: {playerName}. Listen to me.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: The gold in that merchant's purse—it would feed you for a day. Perhaps two.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: And then what? Another purse, another day of fear. The wolf that lives by stealing becomes more wolf, less human.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: I have seen men lose their souls one coin at a time. They do not even notice until they are hollow.

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: What would you have me do? Starve virtuously?

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: Ha! You have spirit. Good—the faith is not for the spiritless.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: No, I would not have you starve. But I would have you live—truly live.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: The Church feeds many in this city. Not with gold stolen from the poor, but with gold freely given by those who remember they will die.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: There is work that needs doing. Work that feeds the soul as well as the body.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: In the eastern quarter, there is a widow—Maria of Chalcedon. Her husband died in the harbor last month.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: She has three children and nothing to feed them. The Church has bread for them, but I cannot go myself today.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: Will you carry it to her? There will be food for you as well—earned, not stolen.

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: (He looks at you as if you are already something more than a thief. It is uncomfortable.)

choices.text: I work for pay, not promises.

accept_mission.speaker: Chrysostom
accept_mission.text: Good. Go to the diaconia near the forum—ask for Deacon Stephanos. He will give you the bread.

accept_mission.speaker: Chrysostom
accept_mission.text: Tell Maria that the Church remembers her. Tell her that her husband's soul is in the hands of Christ, who conquered death.

accept_mission.speaker: Chrysostom
accept_mission.text: When you return, find me. I would hear how she fares.

accept_mission.speaker: System
accept_mission.text: Go to the diaconia near the forum. Speak with Deacon Stephanos.

trust_question.speaker: Chrysostom
trust_question.text: Trust me? You should not. You do not know me.

trust_question.speaker: Chrysostom
trust_question.text: Trust Christ, who said: 'I was hungry and you gave me food.' Trust the widow who waits for bread.

trust_question.speaker: Chrysostom
trust_question.text: I am only an old man who talks too much. They call me 'Golden Mouth,' but gold is soft and words are cheaper still.

trust_question.speaker: Chrysostom
trust_question.text: What matters is not my words but what you do with your hands. Will you help her?

pay_question.speaker: Chrysostom
pay_question.text: Spoken like someone who has learned that promises are empty.

pay_question.speaker: Chrysostom
pay_question.text: Very well. There will be bread for you—good bread, baked this morning. And cheese, if Stephanos has any left.

pay_question.speaker: Chrysostom
pay_question.text: But the greater pay, you will find, is not in the eating.

pay_question.speaker: Chrysostom
pay_question.text: A rich man once asked me: 'Why should I give to the poor?' I told him: 'Because in giving, you become rich.'

pay_question.speaker: Chrysostom
pay_question.text: He did not understand. Perhaps you will.

choices.text: I need to think about it.

decline.speaker: Chrysostom
decline.text: I will not force you. God does not force us, and I am less than God.

decline.speaker: Chrysostom
decline.text: But know this: I will be here tomorrow. And the next day. The doors of the Church are always open.

decline.speaker: Chrysostom
decline.text: When you are ready—if you are ever ready—come find me.

decline.speaker: System
decline.text: ✦ You can speak to Chrysostom again when you're ready. ✦
